name: NewYorker
text:
“Why put us here? Once upon a time, bad things going on Above? Disease stuﬀ, war stuﬀ, famine stuﬀ?” Read a short story by George Saunders.
https://t.co/9yPGot6pdt

name: NewYorker
text: "We could be on the cusp of a historic realignment," @Redistrict says, "and the red wall in the South is looking about as vulnerable today as the blue wall was in the days preceding the 2016 election." https://t.co/x8KSJAA5E0

name: NewYorker
text:
As we approach the Bush v. Gore decision’s 20th anniversary, we may be facing a possible repeat of those events—and perhaps a genuine constitutional crisis around the Presidential election.
https://t.co/koYKhRfVl3

name: NewYorker
text: “When we talk to our friends, we don’t need scripts or guidance,” a co-founder of the organization Vote Tripling said. “No matter how hard I try, you’re going to be way better than I am at getting your friends to vote.” https://t.co/D75QWVkOPx

name: NewYorker
text: The Crown Heights bar and restaurant, which offers bottled cocktails to go and seasonal dishes like a duck-and-apple sandwich, hosts everything from clambakes to movie nights to political postcard drives. https://t.co/lL35Wfxvnr

name: NewYorker
text: “When, prior to lunch today, did you last spend time alone with a woman who is not your wife?” Curtis Sittenfeld reads her short story. https://t.co/2walJ7Lf0E

name: NewYorker
text: “When you touched me, I named / the future: Be here. Stay living.” A poem by @ErikaLSanchez. https://t.co/s63re8MLRl
